DOC.brief_summary: Safety efficacy adjunctive antiplatelet therapy prior primary percutaneous intervention ( PCI ) patient ST-Elevation Myocardial Infarction ( STEMI )
DOC.brief_title: Safety Efficacy Study Adjunctive Antiplatelet Therapy Prior Primary PCI Patients With STEMI
DOC.detailed_description: Patients STEMI undergo primary PCI randomize intravenous ( iv ) bolus placebo vs. PRT060128 prior angiography .
DOC.criteria: Persistent ST elevation ≥ 1mm ( ≥ 0.1mV ) two contiguous limb lead OR ≥ 2 mm ( ≥ 0.2mV ) two contiguous precordial lead , AND chest pain ≥ 20 minute onset within 6 hour hospital presentation . Cardiogenic shock ( systolic blood pressure < 90 mm Hg require vasopressor hemodynamic support ) Uncontrolled hypertension define measure systolic blood pressure ( SBP ) > 180 mm Hg diastolic blood pressure ( DBP ) ≥ 110 mm Hg time History symptom congenital acquire bleed disorder vascular malformation . Recent gastrointestinal bleeding within last 30 day . Known thrombocytopenia ( platelet count < 100,000/mm3 ) . Any treatment fibrinolytic agent within last 7 day .
